Ad Text:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join a critical Health and Safety system implementation project in the construction industry. This is an immediate start opportunity for a professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can deliver exceptional results.

About the Role

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the success of a major system implementation. You will work closely with the Project Manager and key stakeholders to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Gather and document detailed business requirements.

Analyse and map current state processes to identify gaps and opportunities.

Manage relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners, including the system vendor.

Facilitate and lead workshops to drive alignment and clarity.

Collaborate with the Project Manager to ensure project milestones are met.

Lead testing (e.g. UAT) and validation activities to ensure successful implementation.

What We're Looking For

Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst in system implementation projects.

Minimum 8+ years of Senior Business Analyst experience is required.

Essential experience in enterprise systems implementation projects is required.

Strong stakeholder management skills across diverse groups.

Excellent communication and facilitation abilities.

Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.

Availability for an on-site role at the Port of Brisbane, five days per week.

Bachelor's degree qualification is required.

Contract Details

Immediate start

Contract through September 2026

Competitive daily rate

Current Australian work rights are required.

We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst with deep expertise in Energy & Utilities, particularly in Distribution System Operator (DSO) environments and energy-transition programs. This role focuses on business process design and system integration , translating regulatory, operational, and market needs into clear, integrated requirements across OT, IT, and data platforms.

You will work directly with clients, lead workshops, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to define end-to-end processes and integration requirements for DERMS, ADMS, and flexibility services . This is an exciting opportunity to influence large-scale transformation initiatives in the energy sector.

What This Role Offers

Direct Client Engagement: Conduct workshops, interviews, and Agile ceremonies with senior stakeholders.

Energy Transition Leadership: Shape solutions for DER integration, flexibility markets, and dynamic connections.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with architects, integration teams, and delivery squads on complex OT/IT ecosystems.

Innovation & Impact: Drive digital transformation in the utilities sector, influencing sustainability and grid modernization.

Global IBM Network: Access IBM’s global expertise, methodologies, and cutting-edge technologies.

Key Responsibilities

Lead requirements definition for DSO, DERMS, dynamic connections, and flexibility services .

Define end-to-end business processes and system integrations across network, market, and enterprise platforms.

Translate business outcomes into epics, features, user stories, and acceptance criteria in Agile delivery.

Facilitate cross-functional workshops and ensure traceability across business outcomes and delivered capabilities.

Identify integration risks, dependencies, and non-functional requirements (performance, security, resilience).

Support business cases, delivery governance, and change impact assessments .

Collaborate with solution architects on interface, data, and event-based requirements .

Participate in Agile ceremonies: sprint planning, stand-ups, demos, and retrospectives.

Communicate complex technical concepts in simple terms to non-technical stakeholders.

Must-Have Skills & Experience

8+ years defining software requirements for complex products in Agile environments.

5+ years working with Agile practices, including writing epics and user stories.

5+ years in Energy & Utilities, OT & IT Systems focusing on SCADA/ADMS, Asset Management, and Field Mobility solutions.

Expertise in business process modeling (BPMN, UML) and tools like Visio or Aris.

Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

Sound understanding of package implementation methodologies .

Ability to analyse and undertake risk assessment and mitigation treatments for complex changes.

Proficiency in Requirements Management and Storyboard tools for execution and collaboration.

Australian PR or Citizenship required.

Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience with energy-transition initiatives (DERMS, ADMS, DSO platforms).

Familiarity with DER integration (solar, batteries, EVs) and aggregator models.

Exposure to flexibility markets and network support services.

Consulting or large-scale transformation experience.

Knowledge of hybrid delivery models and onshore/offshore collaboration.
